column5: hey all, made a homemade trailer, have all licensing and insurance on it, under 12'. do i need to do anything else before going into canada with me.

[font color=green size=3][b]License and registration from your home state, and you are good to go. Ontario does require a closed (hook) end on your safety chains if you are stopped (rare). The newer style chains have a pivoting tongue that keeps them from coming unhooked. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby
